intro: Thlaspi banaticum, commonly known as the Banat’s cabbages, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in arable fields and along roadsides. It has small, rounded leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellow flowers. Thlaspi banaticum is also known for its ability to accumulate heavy metals, making it a potential candidate for phytoremediation efforts.
